# Load packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, jsonlite, SmartEDA,
                 tidygraph, ggraph)
```
:::


# Import data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kg <- fromJSON("data/MC1_graph.json")
```
:::


## Inspect structure


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
str(kg, max.level=1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
List of 5
 $ directed  : logi TRUE
 $ multigraph: logi TRUE
 $ graph     :List of 2
 $ nodes     :'data.frame':	17412 obs. of  10 variables:
 $ links     :'data.frame':	37857 obs. of  4 variables:
```


:::
:::


## Extract and inspect


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
nodes_tbl <- as_tibble(kg$nodes)
edges_tbl <- as_tibble(kg$links)
```
:::


# Initial EDA


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = edges_tbl,
       aes(y=`Edge Type`)) + 
  geom_bar()
```

![](MC1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = nodes_tbl,
       aes(y=`Node Type`)) + 
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](MC1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

# Create knowledge graph

## Step 1: Mapping from node id to row index


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
id_map <- tibble(id = nodes_tbl$id,
                 index = seq_len(nrow(nodes_tbl)))
```
:::


## Step 2: Map source and target IDs to row indices


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
edges_tbl <- edges_tbl %>%
  left_join(id_map, by = c("source" = "id")) %>%
  rename(from = index) %>%
  left_join(id_map, by = c("target" = "id")) %>%
  rename(to = index)
```
:::


## Step 3: Filter out any unmatched (invalid) edges


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
edges_tbl <- edges_tbl %>%
  filter(!is.na(from), !is.na(to))
```
:::


## Step 4: Create the graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
graph <- tbl_graph(nodes = nodes_tbl,
                   edges = edges_tbl,
                   directed = kg$directed)
```
:::


## Visualize the knowledge graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)
```
:::


## Visualize the whole graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggraph(graph, layout="fr") +
  geom_edge_link(alpha=0.3, 
                 colour = "gray") +
  geom_node_point(aes(color = `Node Type`), size = 4) +
  geom_node_text(aes(label=name),
                 repel=TRUE,
                 size = 2.5) +
  theme_void()
```
:::


## Visualize subset

### Step 1: filter edges to only "Memberof"


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
graph_memberof <- graph %>%
  activate(edges) %>%
  filter(`Edge Type` == "MemberOf")
```
:::


### Step 2: Extract only connected nodes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
used_node_indices <- graph_memberof %>%
  activate(edges) %>%
  as_tibble() %>%
  select(from, to) %>%
  unlist() %>%
  unique()
```
:::


### Step 3: Keep only those nodes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
graph_memberof <- graph_memberof %>%
  activate(nodes) %>%
  mutate(row_id = row_number()) %>%
  filter(row_id %in% used_node_indices) %>%
  select(-row_id) 
```
:::


### Plot the sub-graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggraph(graph_memberof, layout = "fr") +
  geom_edge_link(alpha = 0.5, 
                 colour = "gray") +
  geom_node_point(aes(color = `Node Type`), size = 1) +
  geom_node_text(aes(label=name),
                 repel=TRUE,
                 size = 2.5) +
  theme_void()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](MC1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
